results.title: Soil test
results.brief_description: A soil expert from the Summerland Experimental Farm in the Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, demonstrates the way that a soil moisture meter can tell when it is time to irrigate. Hosted by Julian Biggs.

results.title: Soil structure decline
results.creator_credit: Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture and Gerry North
results.brief_description: After a short period of cultivationn, our soils are losing their inherent structure and are becoming difficult to work. This program discusses soil structure decline and its effect on agricultural productivity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture and Gerry North

results.title: Soil fertility in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union and South African Government
results.brief_description: A note of warning is sounded and attention focused on various malpractices which lead to the deterioration or total destruction of the thin layer of fertile top soil. Remedial and preventative measures are explained and the farmer is encouraged to co-operate with the State in its campaign against retrogressive practices.

results.title: Soil erosion
results.creator_credit: Information Films of India, Ezra Mir and Kenneth Villiers
results.brief_description: India has suffered as much as any other agricultural country from the devastation of soil erosion. This film gives a vivid account of the effects of soil erosion on village life, and shows clearly the dangers of uncontrolled erosion. The Forestry Department of the Indian government is applying various methods to combat erosion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Information Films of India, Ezra Mir and Kenneth Villiers

results.title: Soil conservation for the Snowy Mountains Scheme
results.creator_credit: Snowy Mountains Authority and H Malcolm
results.brief_description: Shows what has been done, by planting grasses, shrubs and trees, to combat soil erosion and cover scarred surfaces which have been left by road-making in the Snowy Mountains Scheme.

results.title: Soil Conservation District: Jerramungup
results.creator_credit: Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture and Gerry North
results.brief_description: Describes how each committee member deals with a land degredation problem. Problems discussed and projects undertaken: wind erosion, tree and saltbush planting, direct drilling research, reduction of salinity and waterlogging in catchment area, growing of lucerne to reduce saline watertable.

results.title: Soil and water: a living world
results.creator_credit: Barr Films, Sandler Institutional Films, Greg Logan and Greg Johnson
results.brief_description: Four children are guided on a scientific adventure looking at the living world of soil and water. Explains how topsoil and water are full of plant and animal life called organisms. Indicates types of activities that can be carried out with these two common natural substances.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barr Films, Sandler Institutional Films, Greg Logan and Greg Johnson

results.title: Soil
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
An explanation of soil profile (topsoil, subsoil, mantle rock and bed rock); plus a visual breakdown of the elements of soil (sand, decaying plant and animal matter and clay). Explains how soil is produced, discusses methods of soil conservation and describes types of soils found throughout the United States.

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Shows what soil is and how it is formed - then illustrates the damaging effects of water and wind erosion. Another damaging depletion is the loss of nutrients in the soil. Illustrates with on the spot examples of how the U.S. conservation service in 1969 combated these projects that range from contour ploughing to land use planning.

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
A plant must absorb essential nutrients from the soil and how a plant utilises essential nutrients and trace elements through the fixed, exchangeable and soluble nutrient pools is shown. The Nitrogen cycle is also explained. Roots absorb soil nutrients and depending on whether there is an excess or defecit of nitrogen, the soil is either acidic or alkaline. Soil texture is explained and the modern day use of hydroponics.
